name: A world of firsts
description: There’s a first time for everything. In their own way, these films, television and videogames each broke ground.

key_work.title: Aussie Rules Footy
key_work.brief_description: Aussie Rules Footy was Beam Software’s first Nintendo Entertainment System (NES) sports game developed exclusively for the Australian market. Despite simple controls, its clever design captured the high-energy, competitive spirit of the sport, featuring spectacular high marking and pushing other players out from under a mark.

constellations_primary.name: A world of firsts
constellations_primary.description: There’s a first time for everything. In their own way, these films, television and videogames each broke ground.

start.title: Willow
start.creator_credit: Ron Howard, Nigel Wooll and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
start.brief_description: Enter the enchanting world of Willow, an epic tale of pure adventure that takes us deep into the world of sorcery and scary monsters, hope and heroism.

constellations_other.name: A world of firsts
constellations_other.description: There’s a first time for everything. In their own way, these films, television and videogames each broke ground.

end.title: Harry Potter and the Philosopher's Stone
end.creator_credit: Chris Columbus, David Heyman, 1492 Pictures, Heyday Films and Warner Bros Pictures
end.brief_description: A stunning visual adaptation of the novel of the same name by British author J.K. Rowling. Ten-year-old Harry Potter is anything but ordinary, he’s a wizard and has been accepted at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

constellations_other.name: A world of firsts
constellations_other.description: There’s a first time for everything. In their own way, these films, television and videogames each broke ground.

links.description: Warwick Davis has appeared in many fantasy films throughout his career, including the Harry Potter films, where he played Professor Flitwick and voiced Griphook.

start.title: The Hobbit
start.material_description: Cassette tape computer game. Cassette & paper booklet in black box
start.brief_description:
“The Hobbit” computer game for BBC Model B.
“The Hobbit” is a single-player text adventure game, originally released for the games platform ZX Spectrum 48K. It was subsequently released for other platforms including BBC. (See Documentation window for full list of game releases).
The adventure is based on J.R.R. Tolkien’s famous book of the same name.
The game cassette is accompanied by a manual with information about the game. Game cassette and manual are contained in a black cardboard box.

constellations_other.name: A world of firsts
constellations_other.description: There’s a first time for everything. In their own way, these films, television and videogames each broke ground.

end.title: Willow
end.creator_credit: Ron Howard, Nigel Wooll and Lucasfilm, Ltd.
end.brief_description: Enter the enchanting world of Willow, an epic tale of pure adventure that takes us deep into the world of sorcery and scary monsters, hope and heroism.

constellations_other.name: A world of firsts
constellations_other.description: There’s a first time for everything. In their own way, these films, television and videogames each broke ground.

links.description: Before Peter Jackson’s 2001 trilogy, other studios attempted to adapt The Lord of the Rings , to no avail. But the influence was still felt in Ron Howard’s Willow starring Warwick Davis as the titular character who was heavily inspired by Tolkein’s work.

constellations_other.name: A world of firsts
constellations_other.description: There’s a first time for everything. In their own way, these films, television and videogames each broke ground.

links.description: Aussie Rules Footy was the first AFL game and one of the first Australian games developed for the NES by Beam Software, who started out with a text-adventure adaptation of the Hobbit, which was developed by Philip Mitchell and Veronika Megler, and released in 1982.

start.title: Hamlet (Olivier)
start.brief_description: Olivier’s version of Hamlet was described by him as “an essay in Hamlet”. The text has been dramatically cut, the order transposed in places, and some new implications worked into the action.

constellations_other.name: A world of firsts
constellations_other.description: There’s a first time for everything. In their own way, these films, television and videogames each broke ground.

end.title: The Maori Merchant of Venice
end.brief_description: A modern day take on the classic bard tale - with Silver as a movie producer.

constellations_other.name: A world of firsts
constellations_other.description: There’s a first time for everything. In their own way, these films, television and videogames each broke ground.

links.description: Shakespeare’s plays are some of the most referenced and adapted works of literature in the world. In 2002, the first-ever Maori language adaptation of a Shakespeare play was released - Te Tangata Whai Rawa o Weniti, or, The Maori Merchant of Venice.

links.description: Harry Potter and the Philosopher’s Stone received Oscar noms for Best Art Direction, Score and Costume Design. When Best Costume was introduced in 1948, it was awarded to one film black & white and one colour film. The first black and white winner was Hamlet.
